criteria: Identification of Theme or Central Idea
descriptions: Student fails to identify a theme or central idea.
Student identifies a theme or central idea, but it is vague or inaccurate.
Student identifies a theme or central idea, but it is oversimplified or lacks depth.
Student identifies a relevant theme or central idea of the text.
Student identifies a clear and relevant theme or central idea of the text with supporting details.
Student identifies a clear, insightful, and relevant theme or central idea of the text with strong supporting details and nuanced understanding.
Student provides no analysis of the theme's development.
Student attempts to analyze the theme's development, but the analysis is unclear or unsupported.
Student provides a superficial analysis of the theme's development with limited supporting evidence.
Student analyzes the theme's development with some relevant evidence from the text.
Student analyzes the theme's development effectively, using relevant textual evidence to support their claims.
Student provides a thorough and insightful analysis of the theme's development, using well-chosen textual evidence to support their claims, demonstrating a deep understanding of the text.
Student's summary is missing or entirely subjective, including personal opinions or biases.
Student's summary includes significant personal opinions or biases, lacking objectivity.
Student's summary demonstrates some objectivity, but personal opinions or biases are still present.
Student provides a mostly objective summary, with minimal personal opinions or biases.
Student provides a clear and objective summary of the text, avoiding personal opinions or biases.
Student provides a concise, comprehensive, and objective summary of the text, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the content and purpose.
